get.description:
Requires `log:read` permission.

This endpoint also accepts search on custom fields through the extra parameters:
- `source.<custom-field>`
- `actor.<custom-field>`
- `resource.<custom-field>`
- `details.<custom-field>`

Example: `/repos/{repo_id}/logs?actor.role=admin`

Example for a boolean custom field: `/repos/{repo_id}/logs?actor.enabled=true`

post.description:
Requires `log:write` permission.

This endpoint acts like a create_log operation, except that:
    - the `emitted_at` field is required
    - the `id` field may be provided.
For classic use cases, it is strongly recommended to use the create_log operation instead.

post.summary: Add a file attachment to a log

parameters.name: log_id

schema.description: The ID of the log to attach the file to

parameters.description: The ID of the log to attach the file to

This endpoint also accepts search on custom fields through the extra parameters:
- `source.<custom-field>`
- `actor.<custom-field>`

parameters.name: columns

schema.description:
Comma-separated list of columns to include in the CSV output. Available columns are:
- `log_id`
- `saved_at`
- `emitted_at`
- `action_type`
- `action_category`
- `actor_ref`
- `actor_type`
- `actor_name`
- `resource_ref`
- `resource_type`
- `resource_name`
- `tag_ref`
- `tag_type`
- `tag_name`
- `attachment_name`
- `attachment_type`
- `attachment_mime_type`
- `entity_path:ref`
- `entity_path:name`
- `source.<custom-field>`
- `actor.<custom-field>`
- `resource.<custom-field>`
- `details.<custom-field>`

Example of column name if you have a "role" custom field for the actor: `actor.role`.

name.description: The name of the attachment. If not provided, the name of the uploaded file will be used.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the attachment. If not provided, the MIME type of the uploaded file will be used.

next_cursor.description: The cursor to the next page of results. It must be passed as the `cursor` parameter to the next query to get the next page of results. `next_cursor` will be null if there are no more results to fetch.

auditize_version.description: The version of Auditize in a `x.y.z` format

ref.description: Actor ref must be unique for a given actor

emitted_at.description: The date and time the log was emitted

source.description: Various information about the source of the event such as IP address, User-Agent, etc...

entity_path.description: Represents the complete path of the entity that the log is associated with.This array must at least contain one item.

parent_entity_ref.description: The ID of the parent entity. It is null for top-level entities.

has_children.description: Indicates whether the entity has children or not

emitted_at.description: The date and time the log was emitted

source.description: Various information about the source of the event such as IP address, User-Agent, etc...

entity_path.description: Represents the complete path of the entity that the log is associated with.This array must at least contain one item.

ref.description: Resource ref must be unique for a given resource

emitted_at.description: The date and time the log was emitted

source.description: Various information about the source of the event such as IP address, User-Agent, etc...

entity_path.description: Represents the complete path of the entity that the log is associated with.This array must at least contain one item.

ref.description: Tag ref is required for 'rich' tags

type.description: If only type is set then it represents a 'simple' tag

name.description: Tag name is required for 'rich' tags

page_size.description: The number of items per page

retention_period.description: The repository retention period in days
The repository retention period in days

The repository retention period in days

stats.description: The repository stats (available if `include=stats` has been set in query parameters)

authenticated_at.description: The date at which the user authenticated for the last time

ref.description: Actor ref must be unique for a given actor
Actor ref must be unique for a given actor
Resource ref must be unique for a given resource

Tag ref is required for 'rich' tags

apikeyAuth.description: The API client must be authenticated through an API key. API keys can be obtained through the Auditize user interface. An API key looks like `aak-ewTddehtMoRjBYtbKzaLy8jqn0hZmh78_iy5Ohg_x4Y` (API keys are always prefixed with `aak-`)
